name: df-lines
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(clines, cmpt(s0, universe, cab(s1, wrex(s2, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wrex(s3, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s2), cv(s3)), wceq(cv(s1), crab(s4, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s4), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), co(cv(s2), cfv(cjn, cv(s0)), cv(s3)))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ Lines =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 | ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà(Atoms ` s0), ‚àÉ(s3 ‚àà(Atoms ` s0),(s2 ‚â† s3 ‚àß s1 = { s4 ‚àà(Atoms ` s0)| s4[(le ` s0)](s2[(join ` s0)]s3)})))})
comment: Define set of all projective lines for a Hilbert lattice (actually in any set at all, for simplicity). The join of two distinct atoms equals a line. Definition of lines in item 1 of [Holland95] p. 222. (Contributed by NM, 19-Sep-2011.)
